001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.nn;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.DomainObject;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Entity;
005import net.tvburger.jdl.model.scalars.NeuronFunction;
006import net.tvburger.jdl.model.scalars.activations.ActivationFunction;
007
008import java.util.Arrays;
009import java.util.List;
010
011/**
012 * Represents a single artificial neuron in a neural network.
013 * <p>
014 * A {@code Neuron} receives inputs from other neurons, computes a weighted sum with a bias
015 * (the pre-activation or "logit"), and applies an {@link ActivationFunction} to produce its output.
016 * The neuron caches its most recent activation so repeated reads are cheap until explicitly
017 * {@linkplain #deactivate() deactivated}.
018 *
019 * <h2>Computation</h2>
020 * For inputs {@code x₁ … xₙ}, weights {@code w₁ … wₙ}, and bias {@code b}:
021 * <pre>
022 *   logit  = b + Σ (wᵢ * xᵢ)
023 *   output = activationFunction.activate(logit)
024 * </pre>
025 *
026 * <h2>Lifecycle</h2>
027 * <ul>
028 *   <li>Before activation, no valid output is available.</li>
029 *   <li>{@link #activate()} pulls inputs from upstream neurons, computes and caches the output.</li>
030 *   <li>{@link #deactivate()} clears the activation state so the neuron can be evaluated again.</li>
031 * </ul>
032 *
033 * <h2>Thread-safety</h2>
034 * <ul>
035 *   <li>{@link #activate()} and {@link #deactivate()} are {@code synchronized} to avoid races.</li>
036 *   <li>Weight/bias mutation is not synchronized; coordinate externally if used concurrently.</li>
037 * </ul>
038 */
039@DomainObject
040@Entity
041public class Neuron extends NeuronFunction {
042
043    private final String name;
044    private final List<? extends Neuron> inputNodes;
045
046    private final float[] inputValues;
047    private float output;
048    private boolean activated;
049
050    /**
051     * Constructs a new neuron with the given name, inputs, and activation function.
052     * <p>
053     * The parameter vector is sized as {@code inputs.size() + 1} where index {@code 0} is the bias
054     * and indices {@code 1..} are the weights corresponding to the {@code inputNodes} order.
055     *
056     * @param name               human-readable identifier for the neuron
057     * @param inputNodes         upstream input neurons in positional order; may be {@code null} for no inputs
058     * @param activationFunction activation applied to the weighted sum
059     * @throws NullPointerException if {@code activationFunction} is {@code null}
060     */
061    public Neuron(String name, List<? extends Neuron> inputNodes, ActivationFunction activationFunction) {
062        super(new float[inputNodes == null ? 0 : inputNodes.size() + 1], activationFunction);
063        this.name = name;
064        this.inputNodes = inputNodes == null ? List.of() : inputNodes;
065        this.inputValues = new float[inputNodes == null ? 0 : inputNodes.size()];
066    }
067
068    /**
069     * Returns the neuron name.
070     *
071     * @return the human-readable identifier
072     */
073    public String getName() {
074        return name;
075    }
076
077    /**
078     * Returns the upstream input neurons feeding this neuron.
079     *
080     * @return an immutable list (possibly empty) of input neurons
081     */
082    public List<? extends Neuron> getInputNodes() {
083        return inputNodes;
084    }
085
086    /**
087     * Returns the cached input values used during the most recent {@link #activate()}.
088     *
089     * @return a snapshot array of input values corresponding to {@link #getInputNodes()}
090     * @throws IllegalStateException if the neuron has not been activated
091     */
092    public float[] getInputValues() {
093        if (!isActivated()) {
094            throw new IllegalStateException("Neuron not activated!");
095        }
096        return inputValues;
097    }
098
099    /**
100     * Computes and caches this neuron's output by:
101     * <ol>
102     *   <li>Reading outputs from {@link #getInputNodes()} into an internal buffer,</li>
103     *   <li>Computing the weighted sum with bias,</li>
104     *   <li>Applying the {@link #getActivationFunction()}.</li>
105     * </ol>
106     * Subsequent calls are no-ops until {@link #deactivate()} is invoked.
107     */
108    public synchronized void activate() {
109        if (getParameterCount() == 0) {
110            activated = true;
111            return;
112        }
113        if (isActivated()) {
114            return;
115        }
116        for (int d = 1; d <= arity(); d++) {
117            inputValues[d - 1] = getInputNodes().get(d - 1).getOutput();
118        }
119        output = estimateScalar(inputValues);
120        activated = true;
121    }
122
123    /**
124     * Indicates whether this neuron has a cached activation result.
125     *
126     * @return {@code true} if {@link #activate()} has been called and not yet {@link #deactivate()}ed; otherwise {@code false}
127     */
128    public boolean isActivated() {
129        return activated;
130    }
131
132    /**
133     * Resets the activated flag so the neuron can be re-evaluated.
134     */
135    public synchronized void deactivate() {
136        activated = false;
137    }
138
139    /**
140     * Returns the post-activation output of this neuron.
141     *
142     * @return the activated output value
143     * @throws IllegalStateException if the neuron has not been activated
144     */
145    public float getOutput() {
146        if (!isActivated()) {
147            throw new IllegalStateException("Neuron not activated!");
148        }
149        return output;
150    }
151
152    /**
153     * Finds the weight associated with a given source neuron.
154     *
155     * @param source the input neuron
156     * @return the corresponding weight, or {@code null} if not found
157     */
158    public Float getWeight(Neuron source) {
159        for (int d = 1; d <= inputNodes.size(); d++) {
160            if (inputNodes.get(d - 1) == source) {
161                return getWeight(d);
162            }
163        }
164        return null;
165    }
166
167    /**
168     * Returns a concise string representation including name, activation state, last output,
169     * weights, and bias.
170     *
171     * @return a human-readable summary of this neuron
172     */
173    @Override
174    public String toString() {
175        return name + "{" + activated + ", " + output + "}" + Arrays.toString(getWeights()) + (getBias() >= 0.0 ? "+" : "") + getBias();
176    }
177
178}
